official-title.#text:
To replace the Director of the Bureau of Consumer
		  Financial Protection with a five person Commission.

sponsor.#tail:
introduced
			 the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Consumer Financial Protection
			 Commission Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 1011 of
			 the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010/s:1011/ss:b, c, d

quote.#tail: ) that shall serve as the head of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau

text.#text:
There is hereby
				established a commission (hereinafter referred to in this section as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may prescribe such
				regulations and issue such orders in accordance with this title as the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may determine to be necessary for carrying out this title and all
				other laws within the Commission’s jurisdiction and shall exercise any
				authorities granted under this title and all other laws within the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau
Commission of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
				be composed of the Vice Chairman for Supervision of the Federal Reserve System
				and 4 additional members who shall be appointed by the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, by and with
				the advice and consent of the Senate, from among individuals who—

text.#text:
are citizens of
				the United States;

should want to protect service members and
				their families who are sacrificing their lives for this country from abusive
				financial practices.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall serve staggered
				terms, which initially shall be established by the

for terms of 1, 2,
				4, and 5 years, respectively.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, including the Chair, shall serve for
				a term of 5 years.

may
				remove any member of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
only for
				inefficiency, neglect of duty, or malfeasance in office.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
appointed to fill a vacancy occurring before the expiration
				of the term to which that member’s predecessor was appointed (including the
				Chair) shall be appointed only for the remainder of the term.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may continue to serve after the
				expiration of the term of office to which that member was appointed until a
				successor has been appointed by the President and confirmed by the Senate,
				except that a member may not continue to serve more than 1 year after the date
				on which that member’s term would otherwise expire.

shall engage in any other business,
				vocation, or employment.
shall have as their primary responsibility the oversight of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
activities pertaining to protecting consumers, with a focus on consumers who
				are older, minorities, youth, or veterans, from unfair, deceptive, and abusive
				lending practices. The designated commissioner shall be responsible for—

conducts regular outreach to consumers regarding industry lending
				activities;

, on a regular basis, the impact of new loan
				and credit products and services on consumers; and
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau

text.#text:
researching and
				reporting to the full

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
coordinates with
				State-level consumer protection agencies on enforcement measures that protect
				consumers from unfair, deceptive, and abusive lending practices.

, not more than 2
				shall be members of any one political party.

text.#text:
With
				respect to members appointed pursuant to

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: from among the members of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, and shall exercise all of the executive and
				administrative functions of the

text.#text:
The Chair shall be the principal executive
				officer of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau

text.#text:
the appointment and supervision of
				personnel employed under the Bureau (other than personnel employed regularly
				and full time in the immediate offices of members of the

the distribution of business among
				personnel appointed and supervised by the Chair and among administrative units
				of the Bureau; and

the use and
				expenditure of funds.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and by such regulatory decisions, findings, and determinations as the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may by law be authorized to make.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau

text.#text:
In
				carrying out any of the Chair’s functions under the provisions of this
				subsection the Chair shall be governed by general policies of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may not be submitted by the Chair without the prior approval of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau
Commission of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau

text.#text:
Requests or estimates for
				regular, supplemental, or deficiency appropriations on behalf of the

header.#text:
Requests or
				estimates related to appropriations

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall impair the right of the
				remaining members of the Commission to exercise all the powers of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
. Three members of the Commission shall constitute a quorum for the
				transaction of business, except that if there are only 3 members serving on the
				Commission because of vacancies in the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, 2 members of the Commission
				shall constitute a quorum for the transaction of business. If there are only 2
				members serving on the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau
Commission of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, 2
				members shall constitute a quorum for the 6-month period beginning on the date
				of the vacancy which caused the number of
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau
Commission of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau

text.#text:
No
				vacancy in the members of the

header.#text:
No impairment by
				reason of vacancies

The
				Chair shall receive compensation at the rate prescribed for level I of the
				Executive Schedule under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall each receive compensation at the rate prescribed
				for level II of the Executive Schedule under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Commission of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
				constitute a quorum for the transaction of business. Following the confirmation
